did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Institute for the Management of Lifelong Education

did.unittitle: Institute for the Management of Lifelong Education (IMLE) Records
did.abstract: Papers from the Harvard University-based institute. Most consists of material from case studies used in the first year of the program

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: The Institute for the Management of Lifelong Education, a product of Harvard University's School of Education, began in 1979. IMLE is a summer leadership seminar designed to provide experienced education administrators an intensive immersion in strategies for and management of change in their field. Techniques include classes, case studies, presentations, discussion, videos, and role plays. It has since been renamed the Institute for Management and Leadership in Education.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Institute for the Management of Lifelong Education (IMLE) Records consists of Program information (a directory and some general introductory information on the case study method) and Case studies (material from four case studies used in the program). The majority of the material comes from a single case study entitled "Davis College."

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: The development of the case study method and its dissemination into various fields of study, particularly public administration, was substantially assisted and influenced by the Inter-University Case Program. The Inter-University Case Program Records, including over a hundred published case studies, reside at the &scrc_name;.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Institute for the Management of Lifelong Education (IMLE) Records,
&su_name;
